intro: Porpax parishii, commonly known as the Cape York porpax, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with high humidity. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Porpax parishii is adapted to withstand periods of drought and is an important part of the local flora in its native habitat.
